headline: Juicy Roasted Chicken
description: This foolproof roasted chicken recipe is easy to prep with just a couple of simple ingredients for a no-fuss, succulent roast chicken every time!

video.name: How to Make Juicy Baked Chicken

name: Juicy Roasted Chicken
recipeIngredient: salt and black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon onion powder, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place chicken in a roasting pan; season generously inside and out with onion powder, salt, and pepper. Place 3 tablespoons of butter in chicken cavity; arrange dollops of remaining butter on the outside of chicken. Cut celery into 3 or 4 pieces; place in the chicken cavity.

Bake chicken uncovered in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Remove from the oven and baste with drippings. Cover with aluminum foil and allow to rest for about 30 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Cooked exactly as directed. Edible, but dry and bland. Sad, this was supposed to be special. I could have saved time and money and bought one of those $5 rotisserie chickens.
Really simple and fast

Best, most juicy roasted chicken recipe that I've tried! I'm on a low sodium diet, so I used unsalted butter --other than that I followed the recipe to a tee. I baked it for 20 minutes per pound of chicken and it was perfect!

This is my first time baking a whole chicken. Didn't follow the recipe exactly, but I think it turned out quite well! Added onions and seasonings to the inside. Seems moist/tender and not too complicated to do. Thanks!

The bake time on this is very wrong. 1 hr 15 in and my chicken was raw and white, no signs of browning. I rubbed it with oil and raised the temp to 375, the temp I usually bake chickens. I will be going back to my tried and true recipe.

Just made this and I‚Äôm no cook. This thing was rockin. Followed the directions but added a half a Spanish onion and some garlic to the cavity and it was amazing. I‚Äôm never going to cook a chicken any other way
Easy to make and easy to follow. Delicious.

Best roast chicken recipe ever. The smells wile roasting are intoxicating and it is the juiciest roast chicken. Follow recipe precisely and do not forget to baste at the end and then tent for 20-30 minutes after basting. Cook 25 minutes per pound at 350.
I made this chicken for the first time it turned out great. My family really enjoyed it. It was really moist and tender.

I've probably used this recipe twice a month for the last 5 years (or more). The entire whole chicken is completely finished the same day I cook it. When I have company, I know this recipe will be perfect. I love it!

I have made this recipe multiple times, each time changing up the spices and cutting back a bit on the butter. It's all a matter of preferences and experimenting. Each time the chicken has been succulent and not "swimming" in butter as the ones-tar reviewer claims. It's about changing things up according to your own oven quirks and your tastes. If something doesn't turn out the way you expected, then CHANGE IT UP instead of never making it again after seeing consistent 4 and 5 star ratings. Just a thought.

I love roast chicken and this is the first recipe that cooks it perfectly! The high start temp seals in all the juices and following cooking times for your chicken‚Äôs weight makes this a breeze. I roast it over vegetables and the whole family love it!
made this several times. It is ALWAYS delicious. It looks too easy to be great, but it is. It is a go to recipe and I have yet to have someone not like it.

This is the best roast chicken recipe ever. I‚Äôll make chicken like this from now on. I didn‚Äôt change anything except the roasting time since my chicken was six pounds. The leftovers will make a delicious soup.

I have free range chickens that I have purchased and honestly, I have never baked whole chickens. I cannot believe how good this was! The meat was perfect and truly delicious. very very simple recipe. I use the carcass for soup or just bone broth to freeze after. Perfection
Really good and really easy!

I been using this roast recipe every Thanksgiving and Christmas. It is tender and juicy. I modify cook time to 400 Fahrenheit for 1.5 hr then 375 Fahrenheit for half hr. My family loves this roast every time. I share this recipe with my family and friends and recommend to use it for your next roast. Thank you!
Added some fresh parsley and lemon juice. It was a hit at our house.

The recipe is fantastic and the chicken turned out perfect! I had a 6 lb chicken (couldn't find a 3lb) and used convection roast at 325degrees for 2 hours, with a temperature probe set to 160 in the thigh. Family loved it! Crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Everybody happy!

Made this horrible recipe for Thanksgiving with two chickens and they both bombed to the point of being inedible. It's the Paula Dean method of soaking everything in butter to avoid dry meat by adding 20,000 calories. First off, 75 minutes is completely inadequate time to cook chicken. It was bright pink at that time, and sitting in a 3 inch pool of butter with no ability to actually bake. I left it in for another 45 minutes to void getting salmonella poisoning, and the meat was evaporated. Gone. Like, no meat at all. I went from two extremes in one shot. It completely ruined Thanksgiving dinner and I wouldn't make this recipe again even at gunpoint. Horrible.

I have made this many many times. Preheat oven to 350 and cook for exactly 1hr & 15 min; remove and cover 30 min. The changes I made was using garlic powder, salt, and mrs. dash seasoning. I season the cavity as well, and add rosemary in the cavity with carrots. I get under the skin on the breast with olive oil and seasoning as well. Then follow the exact directions for baking to the letter, and it's PERFECT every time I made it. So tender, juicy, perfectly cooked meat; the white meat is glistening tender and juicy. Thank you. This has been my new go to recipe when making holiday for two; my husband and self.
Good and very juicy. However after 2 hours of roasting, still undercooked. Had everything else ready and had to put chicken back into oven. "-(
Great recipe. I substituted a couple ingredients that did not have but still turned out perfect. Thanks

This is a great recipe üôå At my restaurant I cook mostly the same but I tend to roast the chicken slightly longer to ensure that the chicken is juicy. üëâ Feel free to check out my recipes that I use at my restaurant by visiting my profile ü§ó Bon App√©tit!

I had an almost 6lb chicken and followed the recipe as far as temperatures and time. I used Mrs. Dash seasoning in addition to sea salt and onion powder and used butter under the skin. I'm pretty sure it's the best result I've ever had. We loved this one and will make it again!
superb recipe. love it

Learning to cook and it was as good as my wife ever made. Turned out great and the only thing I changed was adding a halved tomato inside instead of celery, which I didn't have. The stewed tomato was great though.

DELICIOUS!!!!!!! I also sprinkled garlic powder on the skin and inside along with the onion powder. It was perfect!!!!! To determine the baking time, bake 20 minutes per pound. My chicken was 6.58 pounds so it had to cook longer. It is important to check the chicken temperature to make sure that the chicken is done.
Use butter!!!! Very juicy and tasty!

Nothing left to save. Family loved it. Husband is not a chicken fan but it‚Äôs been added to the list of likes!!! Followed directions for the most part but didn‚Äôt measure the salt and pepper. Forgot to take picture :(
This chicken recipe is perfect! probably the best whole chicken I've ever baked! Loved the onion powder, celery and butter! Did as directed and it was fabulous!
Absolutely fabulous! All I added was fresh lemon & garlic. Will pass it on Thanks Denise

The grocery store was sold out of rotisserie chicken and I‚Äôve sucked at cooking whole chicken in the past. I don‚Äôt mess with margarine, oil and butter are pretty equal in fat and I love some unsalted butter. To get the effect of margarine, I recommend putting butter inside the cavity with the celery and fresh garlic or minced. Brush or drizzle a neutral oil on top of your bird, alittle goes a long way. If you use Cajun seasoning like another person recommended I suggest using a no salt or low salt one and adding salt after to keep it balanced. This is better than rotisserie, my life has changed! I saved the drippings and broth in a mason jar and will either make a soup or gravy with it this week. Ate part of the chicken for dinner with the celery and shredded the rest of the chicken to make some delicious chicken salad to meal prep for the week. You can freeze cooked chicken for up to 3 months.

I used this recipe for the first time I ever made a whole chicken. Currently using this recipe for the 2nd time and the chicken is in the oven. I have VERY picky kids. Guess what?? They ALL loved this recipe!! Thank you so much for sharing!!

Perfectly juicy and tender with insta-worthy browning. I presented her with some crinkle cut sweet potato crescents for an easy family-style meal! Adding this one to my favorites...easily replacing the store bought deli chicken.

Turned out great. Made a couple of changes. Used a 6 lb bird so cooking time was 1 hour 40 minutes in a convection oven to get to safe internal temp. Stuffed cavity with an orange rather than vegetables. Turned out fantastic!
Super easy! I made a curry spice mix and used an apple instead of celery. It's currently cooling, but I can't wait to tear into this!

The chicken had a very nice flavor and was very juicy and tender. The only thing I changed is using two stalks of celery instead of one. I'm definitely going to make this chicken again and I may add garlic and thyme next time. But, this recipe is great on it's own.

I followed the recipe ver batum ! I decided to try tying the wings and legs together to try to retain the moisture. I checked on it after 45 minutes to baste with a brush, but there were no juices at that point. But was browning nicely. I did cook an additional 15 minutes. It did finally leave a small bit of juices when finished so I basted it good and let it rest for 30 minutes. After carving, I would suggest 1 hr 45 minutes cooking time. My bird was around 3lbs. This is an excellent recipe ! Juicy and tender with tons of flavor ! Looks awesome !
Very, very juicy! Daughter said it was better than "roasteria" (she means rotisserie) chicken!
A wonderful recipe. Consistently produces tasty, moist chicken. My go to chicken recipe and always enjoyed by the family.
I cook 2hr and still wasn‚Äôt done. I had to leave for an hour, so I covered it with foil and turn it down to 250. When I came back it was perfect! Moist and delicious!

The cooking time is definitely not accurate. I had to cook this for 2 1/2 hours at 350¬∞. The only thing I changed was using fresh garlic and onion rather than powder seasoning. It is definitely moist and falls off the bone! Thank you for sharing the recipe!

I did a little different, covered for 40 minutes at start and then uncovered the rest. reason why I took all the juice out after the 40 minutes and did home made gravy with a tab of flower and little water till the texture was perfect. A+ perfection. thanks!
everyone loved it...i did put stuffing in the cavity .. i am not a real cook, but no onw knew

This recipe was awesome!! The chicken was moist and delicious. The only thing different was I used Croatian seasoning and because I had a three pound chicken it took a little longer to cook. Will definitely make this again!! Thank you for such a great recipe!üíïüíï
not enough seasoning
The cook time is not correct. Chicken was NOT done. At this temp it needs to be longer, or a higher temp for 1hr 15min
Delicious as written, added onions, carrots and potatoes, extra celery, fennel, and extra seasonings put the butter under the skin .
It was dilicious and came off the bone. I will def make this once a week for us
DELICIOUS!!

I've made this a dozen times or more. The family LOVES it - it's always juicy and tender! The gravy from the drippings is perfect. It's become part of the regular rotation. I always have to cook it for about 2.5 hours. I think that's because the recipe is written for a 3 lb chicken and I usually get one over 5 lbs so it needs a bit more time to cook.
It's an okay base recipe for a whole roasted chicken. But where are the seasonings? Salt pepper and onion made for a bland bird. Second time I made this I ended up having to add a bunch more.
This is the only roasted chicken recipe I use, it always comes out sooo good!
Not done but I kn it‚Äôs gonna be good thx u
Thank you for a wonderful recipe. Very tasty and moist Roast chicken.
This recipe is my go to for baked chicken! The chicken is moist every time and has great flavor. I usually have a 5lb chicken so I bake it 25 minutes per pound.
Worked great for me, and I‚Äôm a horrible cook! Thank you!
So easy to make and tastes unbelievably good! I‚Äôm actually making this recipe for the second time in a week! Thanks for sharing
I did add a different seasoning instead of onion powder

This turned out juicy and tasted great! Stuffed the chicken with celery and added half a lemon and smashed garlic cloves. Cooked this in a Dutch oven and just used the lid to cover, instead of foil. Great recipe, thanks for sharing! Will definitely make again!
I Love this chicken it‚Äôs so juicy and tasty, and very simple to make.
This is my go-to chicken recipe. I make it exactly as in the recipe, no changes. Comes out perfect every time.
Simple, but delicious!
Juicy chicken. Didnt have the celery, still excellent.

It tasted incredible. I Added potatoes, carrots and onions to the bottom and then placed the seasoned chicken on top. I added rosemary and lemon and it was delicious!! As for the cook time, I always use a meat thermometer to 170 degrees + depending on the size of the chicken. Mine took longer as it was a large chicken. Enjoy!!!

My go to for roasted chicken was always a lemon in the chicken with seasoning and its good, but not consistent and limits leftover options (lemony) I've made this few times and the chicken is always juicy and flavorful. Only change I made was butter over margarine (personal preference), but it's spot on and full of flavo AND leftovers can be used in so many dishes!
simple but delicious

3.3.10 ... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/83557/juicy-roasted-chicken/ ... "This chicken is so good!" my twelve year old boy said who doesn't give compliments! 'One of those simple recipes that transforms in the oven. It gave me inspiration to try placing granny smith apple pieces in the next one. Good, too! 3/27/12'Didn't like it as much this time. 'Not blaming the recipe, but maybe the chicken? 'Remember it being juicy, but this time was bordering on greasy. 'Not blaming the recipe since it isn't basted frequently. 'May have liked the granny smith apple better, too - or both - but that wouldn't affect the grease factor. 'Used perdue, big 7pounder, this last time. 'Maybe it was another brand w first review. 'Probably decrease it next time, just to be sure ... 8 20 17 Used 6T. 2T in + 4T on = YUM! 3-2022 'Tried 2T marg in pieces inside & 2T thinly sliced on. Half garlic, half onion powders. Half a Fuji apple, cut in two, inside.Still great!
TURNS OUT PERFECT EVERYTIME! I've even sent it of friends and family. Sometimes I add lemon to the cavity and roasting pan also add water to the pan. Gravy is crazy good.

So easy and so delicious. I used butter and it turned out just fine. Out the oven, skin was crispy which I love. I basted and covered with tin foil. Skin no longer crispy. Next time I am going to skip the piece and see what happens. There will definitely be a next time and soon!
Excellent and simple to make. Thank you.
Very easy. Wonderfully juicy. Everyone loved it.
its good
Easy And delish!!

I made exactly to recipe and though it turned out rather moist, it lacked flavor. It was okay but I am still going to keep looking for the perfect roasted chicken. Giving it 4 stars for the moistness and the ease of fixing this recipe.
I made some changes but this is my favorite way to make chicken. I add butter under the skin mixed with seasoning. Comes out perfectly
All recipes never disappoints but it was a total failure today. At 1 hr 15 mins the temp was just barley over 100 degrees. Kids are starving and just had to eat the sides.
Garlic SALT is key
Perfect.
Temp/cook time are not correct
I made this twice once with garlic powder and again with onion powder. It turned out juicy and moist. It's my go to for a quick and easy meal.
great
I love this chicken! I have made it several times and it's amazing every time. Juicy and flavorful. Easy to make. Thank you for sharing.

The recipe was so good and my family loved it. I just made some adjustments by adding a full lime & 7-8 garlic clove in the cavity. Plus i sprinkled cajun seasoning and chili powder on the chicken. It turned so good and flavorful.
Excellent! Made exactly as written then added some rosemary. Made the best gravy ever! Adding this recipe to our 'regulars'.
Turned out great.
I use this same recipe when cooking turkey, only I rub under skin with margerine when doing turkey, great simple recipe!
They were not kidding this is really juicy chicken. The only thing different I did was forget the celery. I also added cayenne pepper. I love anything spicy.

I roasted a 7 lb chicken and followed the recipe except added garlic cloves (and butter) under the skin. I didn‚Äôt have a roasting pan rack so I placed large carrots underneath the bird, also used both onion and garlic powder. I cooked it in my convection oven at 350 for a little over 2 hrs and let it ‚Äúrest‚Äù for the prescribed 30 minutes. An absolute hit. Juicy and perfect. Goes into my dinner rotations.
This is perfect. The breast was very juicy and the meat was very flavorful. I will make it again.
Loved it - admit I used butter instead of margarine.

This recipe is simple, yet the result is absolutely delicious. I followed all the steps except for the melted butter at the end, I thought I‚Äôd already used enough butter. Saved the recipe, I will definitely make this again. Thank you for sharing.
Cooking time 2.50 hours at least. Wait until the leg falls off to touch.

I saved this recipe because it was simple and easy. Made it tonight for the first time and it really exceeded all expectations. 
So simple, so good and we enjoyed it. 
Made it in a cast iron skillet which seemed to speed up the cook time and placed a trivet underneath as well. 
Will make it again for sure. 
Thanks for posting this recipe!
Really good! Made it like recipe and even my son who doesn't have seconds on meat had another helping. Forgot to take a picture before but this is all that is left. Will do it again
It was delicious but I had to cook it longer because it wasn't done. I would increase the temp and time.
What a wonderful recipe. EASY and tastes really good. Thank you for sharing. This is my 'go to' for chicken.
Made 3 time now. Most of my hens have been 7lb and still don't change a thing. Amazing
